intro: Dianella odorata f. bancana, commonly known as the fragrant lily or sweet lily, is a striking ornamental plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, fragrant white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value lies in its elegant appearance and pleasant scent, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
